intro: Cyrtandra lanuginosa, commonly known as the wooly cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Cyrtandra lanuginosa is often found in Hawaii and other parts of Oceania, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
